line_1: The ladies a glass or two only requir'd,
line_2: To th' drawing-room then in due order retir'd;

line_1: Masters were sought for what they each required,
line_2: And books were bought and harpsichords were hired;

line_1: Who call'd him forth, his services requir'd,
line_2: When like the Roman to his field retir'd,

line_1: My silent search in vain requir'd!
line_2: Truths which, from action's paths retir'd,
My waiting Servants by Command retir'd;

line_1: With feeble cries thy last sad aid required,
line_2: Stretch'd its stiff limbs, and on thy lap expired! —

line_1: Yet, since there was such haste requir'd;
'If this, the latest act from me requir'd,
line_2: 'The last is good, 'he said, and — he expir'd.

line_1: The more we give, the more is still requir'd:
line_2: 'Tis most our Trouble when 'tis most admir'd;

line_1: The Cloak of Wedlock, as the Case requir'd;
line_2: TWO long had Lov'd, and now the Nymph desir'd,

line_1: He heard, and strait the cause requir'd,
line_2: With wonder more than envy fir'd.

line_1: If not that hope the scripture has requir'd:
line_2: Your hope shall stand unblam'd, perhaps admir'd,
